p: For determining the lubricating performance and wear mechanism, the wear scar of the lower ball after four-ball tests in the oil mixtures were observed. Figure 7 displays the morphologies of wear scar of the lower ball under lubrication conditions of PAO oil containing different contents of Mg(ReO 4) 2 additive. It is clearly seen that the wear scar under base oil lubrication was seriously damaged with a deeper and wider plough, and some fine debris was distributed in the furrows ( Figure 7a), illustrating that severe wear and plow occurred in the test process, which was attributed to the poor lubricating film bearing strength generated by the PAO base stock only. In contrast to that lubricated by pure oil, the wear scars under PAO with Mg(ReO 4) 2 additive lubrication were smoother, and the furrows were relatively narrow and shallow ( Figure 7b–d). This revealed the synthesized Mg(ReO 4) 2 as lubricating additive was effective in reducing wear of the steel–steel friction pair to a certain degree when it was added into the PAO synthetic oil. This might be ascribed to the generation of a positive protection layer on the contact interface.
